Name: Acid Burrower
Description: A horse-sized insect with digging claws and acidic blood.
Tactics: Burrow, Drag Away, Feed, Reposition
Text1: This adversary may activate twice in a GM move.
Quote1: “They move with incredible speed.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to have this adversary burst out of the ground, causing anyone within Very Close to make an Agility (14) reaction roll or be knocked over and Vulnerable until they next act.
Quote2: “They burrow themselves deep and explode out from under you.”
Text3: Make an attack against all targets in front of the Acid Burrower within Close range. On a success, deal 2d6+3 phy damage and make their armor score is halved until the next time they repair it.
Quote3: “The acid starts to eat away at your armor.”
Text4: When this adversary takes Severe damage, all targets within Close range are bathed in its acidic blood, dealing 2d8+5 phy damage (armor is half as effective against this damage). This splash covers the ground within a Very Close distance with acid blood, and any movement through it by another creature automatically deals 1d6 damage.
Quote4: “As you strike them, you’re covered in their cold, corrosive blood.”

Name: Archer Guards
Description: Tall guards bearing a longbow and quiver with arrows fletched in the settlement’s colors.
Tactics: Close Gates, Pin Down, Arrest, Make it Through the Day
Text1: Make an attack against a target in Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 2d8+5 phy damage and give the target disadvantage on all Agility rolls until they clear at least one marked HP.
Quote1: “An arrow pierces your leg, knocking you to the ground mid-stride.”

Name: Bear
Description: A large beast with thick fur and powerful claws.
Tactics: Climb, Defend Territory, Pummel, Track
Text1: Creatures that mark HP from this creature’s Claws attack are knocked out of melee.
Quote1: “The flurry of claws send you flying backwards.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to make a bite attack against a target in melee. On a success, deal 3d4+10 damage and make them Restrained. They can escape on a Strength roll.
Quote2: “A powerful bite clamps down onto you, keeping you from moving.”

Name: Bladed Guards
Description: Armored guards bearing a sword and shield painted in the settlement’s colors.
Tactics: Arrest, Close Gates, Pin Down, Make it Through the Day
Text1: The difficulty to move through anywhere within Close range around this adversary is increased by 1 for each Bladed Guard within melee range of one another.
Quote1: “The line of guards in an immovable wall of stubbornness and armor.”
Text2: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to make the target Restrained. They can break free on a successful attack against the adversary or on a Strength or Finesse roll.
Quote2: “They hold you with an iron grip and begin to lead you away.”

Name: Brawny Zombie
Description: A large corpse, decay-bloated and angry.
Tactics: Destruction, Crush, Slam, Hail Debris
Text1: It takes 2 action tokens to activate this adversary.
Quote1: “A lumbering figure moves towards you in the darkness.”
Text2: On a successful attack in melee, mark a Stress to make the target Restrained and force them to mark 2 Stress (in addition to normal damage).
Quote2: “The zombie grabs you and holds fast. You need to escape before it tears you apart.”
Text3: When the Brawny Zombie has a target Restrained, make an attack with advantage. On a success, armor cannot be used against this damage.
Quote3: “The zombie pulls on your limbs, trying to tear you apart like an angry child with a doll.”

Name: Cave Ogre
Description: A massive humanoid who sees all sapient life as food.
Tactics: Throw Enemies, Bite Off Heads, Feast, Rip Limbs, Stomp
Text1: When a PC uses an Armor Slot to reduce incoming damage from the Cave Ogre, it is only half as effective.
Quote1: “The ogre can shatter armor as easily as break bones.”
Text2: When this creature takes Major or Severe Damage, they rampage. Move them to somewhere within Close range and deal 2d6+3 direct physical damage to anyone they would cross through to get there.
Quote2: “Enraged by your attack, the enemy charges forward.”
Text3: Mark a Stress to pick up heavy objects and throw them at all targets in front of the ogre up to Far range. Make an attack roll against these targets. Any you succeed against take 3d4+12 phy damage.
Quote3: “A boulder flies towards you, too large and too fast to run from.”

Name: Construct
Description: A roughly humanoid being of stone and steel assembled and animated by magic.
Tactics: Serve Creator, Smash Target, Destroy Environment, Trample Groups
Text1: Physical damage dealt to the Construct does +1 Hit Points.
Quote1: “The creature’s shifting form is vulnerable to the bolts of your crossbow.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to add +10 to a damage roll this adversary makes. Construct may then activate again.
Quote2: “The construct swells with arcane energy, powering itself up.”
Text3: When this adversary moves during an activation, mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets in its path. On a success, deal 2d6+5 physical damage.
Quote3: “They run towards you with reckless abandon, stomping everything in their path.”
Text4: When this creature marks its last Hit Point, the magic powering it ruptures in an explosion of force. Make an attack against all targets within Very Close range with advantage. On a success, deal 2d4+8 magic damage.
Quote4: “As it falls, the magic within ruptures and explodes.”

Name: Courtier
Description: An ambitious and ostentatiously dressed socialite.
Tactics: Discredit, Gain Favor, Maneuver, Scheme
Text1: Mark a Stress to say something mocking and force a target within Close range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (14) to see if they can save face. If they fail, they mark 2 Stress and are Vulnerable for the remainder of the scene.
Quote1: “Was that song written out of tune, or do you just play it that way?”
Text2: Spend a Fear and choose a PC as the target. The courtier convinces a crowd or prominent individual that this target is the cause of their current conflict or misfortune.
Quote2: “From across the hall, you see a finger, bedecked in fine rings, pointing at you.”

Name: Deeproot Defender
Description: A burly vegetable-person with grasping vines
Tactics: Ambush, Grab, Protect, Pummel
Text1: Slam the ground, knocking any targets within Very Close range into Far range. Each character knocked back this way marks Stress.
Quote1: “Their fists slam to the ground, and the shockwave sends you flying.”
Text2: Make an attack roll against a close target. On a success, spend a Fear to pull them into melee, deal 2d8+3 phy damage, and make them Restrained. This condition ends the next time the bruiser takes Severe Damage.
Quote2: “They reach out with their vines and ensnare you, pulling you in.”

Name: Dire Wolf
Description: A large wolf with menacing teeth, seldom encountered alone.
Tactics: Defend Territory, Harry, Protect Pack, Surround, Trail
Text1: When making a Claws attack, if another Dire Wolf is also in melee range of the target, deal 2d6+8 phy damage instead.
Quote1: “When they work in packs, they’re more bold, more vicious.”
Text2: Make an attack against a target in melee range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 3d4+10 phy damage and make them Vulnerable until they heal a Hit Point.
Quote2: “With a snarl, they lunge at you, sinking their teeth in deep.”

Name: Giant Mosquitos
Description: Dozens of fist-sized mosquitoes, flying together for protection.
Tactics: Harass, Steal Blood, Fly Away
Text1: Cannot be targeted by effects that impact balance or the ground. +2 Difficulty when at least a Very Close distance off the ground.
Quote1: “The swarm nimbly maneuvers around your blows.”
Text2: Mark Stress when an attack by Giant Mosquitos causes a character to mark HP. They must mark +1 HP.
Text3: If Giant Mosquito swarm has marked half or more of their HP, they deal 2d4+2 phy damage instead of their normal damage.

Name: Giant Rat
Description: A cat-sized rodent skilled at scavenging and survival.
Tactics: Burrow, Scavenge, Hunger, Wear Down
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Giant Rats within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 3 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Giant Scorpion
Description: A human-sized insect with tearing claws and a stinging tail.
Tactics: Ambush, Feed, Grapple, Poison
Text1: Mark a Stress to make a Pincers attack against two targets within range. On a success, deal 2d8+5 phy damage to each.
Quote1: “Their massive claws strike out at both of you.”
Text2: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to deal 3d4+10 phy damage and Envenomate them. While Envenomated, before they make an action roll, they must roll a d6. If the result is a 4 or below, they mark a stress. Envenomated clears at their next short rest or on a successful Knowledge (16) roll.
Quote2: “You feel the hot venom rush through your veins.”

Name: Glass Snake
Description: A clear serpent with a head the size of a human that leaves behind a glass shard trail wherever it goes.
Tactics: Climb, Feed, Keep Distance, Scare
Text1: Any successful melee attacks against this creature also mark an armor slot on the attacker.
Quote1: “Though the strike hits true, its glass scales shred your armor.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Any target hit takes 1d8+5 phy damage.
Quote2: “It spins violently, its sharp body striking in every direction.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to introduce a Spitter d6 die. Anytime the Glass Snake activates, roll this die. On a 5+, all targets in front of the snake within Far range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 2d6+3 damage. This does not use the snake’s activation.
Quote3: “Hundreds of shards of pearlescent glass spiral towards you.”

Name: Green Ooze
Description: A moving mound of translucent green slime.
Tactics: Creep up, Envelop, Camouflage, Consume & Multiply
Text1: The GM must spend two tokens to activate this adversary.
Quote1: “They take a moment to react, and you can tell they’re not as quick as you are.”
Text2: Any successful melee attacks this creature makes also marks an Armor Slot on the target. This doesn’t reduce any damage.
Quote2: “The residue eats away at your armor, corroding it slowly.”
Text3: Make an attack against a target in melee. On a success, envelop them, immediately dealing 2 Stress. Every time an action token is placed on the tracker, deal an additional Stress. They will break free the next time the ooze takes Severe damage.
Quote3: “The ooze encircles you, drawing you into its gelatinous form.”
Text4: When this adversary marks its 3rd Hit Point, spend a Fear to split it into two Tiny Green Oozes (with no marked Hit Points or Stress). They may immediately activate without spending tokens.
Quote4: “You watch as the damage you’ve done splits it in half… becoming two oozes instead of one.”

Name: Harrier
Description: A nimble fighter armed with javelins.
Tactics: Harry, Kite, Flank, Profit
Text1: After making an attack, Harrier may move anywhere within Far range.
Quote1: “They move with purpose across the battlefield, away from the fray.”
Text2: When a PC moves into melee to make an attack, Harrier may mark a Stress before the attack roll to move anywhere within Close range and make a Javelin attack on them. A success deals 1d8+7 phy damage.
Quote2: “They won’t let you get close, instead turning an attack back on you.”

Name: Head Guard
Description: A seasoned guard with a mace, whistle, and a bellowing voice.
Tactics: Command, Close Gates, Pin Down, Arrest, Seek Glory
Text1: Fear Spend a Fear to activate Head Guard and up to 2d4 allies with Far range, without spending additional action tokens.
Text2: Countdown (5) Activate when this creature sees any number of hostile targets. It ticks down anytime a PC makes an attack roll. When triggered, all Archer Guards within Far range fire at their nearest target with advantage. If any hit the same target, add their damage together.
Quote2: “With the wave of a hand, a rain of arrows falls down upon you.”

Name: Jagged Knife Bandit
Description: A cunning criminal in a heavy cloak bearing one of the gang’s iconic knives.
Tactics: Escape, Profit, Throw Smoke
Text1: This adversary can climb just as easily as they can run.
Quote1: “They get to higher ground.”
Text2: Make an attack from above a target. On a success, deal 3d4+10 physical damage.
Quote2: “They drop in from above and take no mercy.”

Name: Jagged Knife Hexer
Description: A staff-wielding bandit in a cloak, adorned with magical paraphernalia, using curses to vex their foes.
Tactics: Command, Hex, Profit, Warp
Text1: Target a creature within Far range and make them Cursed. While Cursed, on any rolls made with Hope, this adversary can mark a Stress to make it with Fear instead.
Quote1: “A wave of nausea passes over you, as you realize you’ve been cursed.”
Text2: Make an attack against up to three targets within Very Close range. Mark a Stress to deal 2d6+3 magic damage to any you are successful against.
Quote2: “They unleash a flurry of writhing magic in all directions.”

Name: Jagged Knife Kneebreaker
Description: An imposing brawler carrying a large club.
Tactics: Intimidate, Grapple, Profit, Steal
Text1: Characters Restrained by this adversary take double damage from attacks by other adversaries in the scene.
Quote1: “They have you pinned and you know that’s bad news.”
Text2: Make an attack against a target in melee. On a success, they take no damage but are Restrained and Vulnerable. A PC can break free by with Strength (12) roll or are let go automatically when Major damage or higher is dealt to the Bruiser.
Quote2: “They slam you to the ground with unbelievable strength.”

Name: Jagged Knife Lackey
Description: A commonly-dressed thief with small daggers, eager to prove themselves.
Tactics: Escape, Profit, Throw Smoke
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Jagged Knife Lackeys within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 3 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Jagged Knife Lieutenant
Description: A seasoned bandit in quality leathers with a strong voice and cunning eyes.
Tactics: Bully, Command, Profit, Reinforce
Text1: Mark a Stress to activate this adversary and two allies within Close range of them (do not spend additional action tokens for the allies).
Quote1: “They give the orders, and they’re followed without hesitation.”
Text2: Summon 3 Jagged Knife Lackeys, who appear at Far range.
Quote2: “You see more trouble headed your way.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Close range. If successful, deal 2d6+12 phy damage and force the target to mark a Stress.
Quote3: “They see you struggling and move to end this.”

Name: Jagged Knife Shadow
Description: A nimble scoundrel bearing a wicked knife and utilizing shadow magic to isolate targets.
Tactics: Ambush, Conceal, Divide, Profit
Text1: On a successful Daggers attack that has advantage, deal 2d6+8 phy damage instead.
Quote1: “They exploit your weakness and hit you where it hurts.”
Text2: Become Hidden until after this adversary’s next attack. Any attacks made while Hidden have advantage.
Quote2: “They can disappear in plain sight.”

Name: Jagged Knife Sniper
Description: A lanky bandit striking from cover with a shortbow.
Tactics: Hide, Ambush, Profit, Reposition
Text1: If the Sniper is Hidden when they hit an enemy, the attack deals 2d8+5 phy instead of their normal damage.
Quote1: “From the shadows, an arrow with deadly aim flies towards you.”

Name: Merchant
Description: A finely dressed trader with a keen eye for profit.
Tactics: Buy Low/Sell High, Create Demand, Inflate Prices, Seek Profit
Text1: A character that succeeds at a social action against the Merchant gains a discount on purchases. Any character that fails on a social action against the merchant must pay more and is at disadvantage on future social actions against the Merchant.
Quote1: “There’s an added service fee for enemies.”
Text2: Any Presence roll made against the Merchant below 15 causes the character to mark a Stress.
Quote2: “You can’t swindle a professional swindler.”

Name: Minor Chaos Elemental
Description: A coruscating mass of uncontrollable magic.
Tactics: Confound, Destabilize, Transmogrify
Text1: This adversary is resistant to magic damage.
Quote1: “You watch as some of your magic is reflected off of the chaos.”
Text2: When this adversary takes damage, deal half that damage to the attacker if they are within Close range.
Quote2: “The harder you hit it, the more force is blasted back at you.”
Text3: Mark a Hit Point to cause all PCs within Close range to mark a Stress and become Vulnerable until their next short rest or they have a Stress cleared.
Quote3: “Your stomach drops and your head swims.”
Text4: Spend a Fear to transform the area within Very Close range into a different biome. Any other creature within this area takes 2d6+3 direct damage.
Quote4: “You feel the world twist around you, your mind reeling.”

Name: Minor Demon
Description: A crimson-hued creature from the realms below, consumed by rage against all mortals.
Tactics: Torment, Corral Targets, Relish Pain, Act Erratically
Text1: This adversary may activate twice in a GM move.
Quote1: “They move with incredible speed.”
Text2: Any PC that rolls a failure with Fear within a Close distance of Minor Demon loses Hope.
Quote2: “Light around you seems to dim as the fight becomes more dire.”
Text3: When rolling damage, mark a Stress to add the Demon’s current number of marked Hit Points to the value of the damage inflicted.
Quote3: “As hard as you’ve hit, the demon hits back harder.”
Text4: Fear Spend a Fear to rain hellfire on everything within Far range. All targets within the area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 3d4+12 mag damage. Targets that succeed take half damage.
Quote4: “You smell smoke as the sky above you fills with streaks of fire.”

Name: Minor Fire Elemental
Description: A living flame the size of a large bonfire.
Tactics: Start Fires, Encircle Enemies, Grow in Size, Intimidate
Text1: This adversary may activate twice in a GM move.
Quote1: “They move with incredible speed.”
Text2: When you move onto any objects that are highly flammable, consume them to clear 1 HP or 1 Stress. You may do this three times a scene.
Quote2: “The Elemental spits with fire, consuming the barrels beneath it, growing stronger.”
Text3: Mark a Stress to choose a point within Far range. The ground within Very Close range of that point immediately bursts into flames. Anyone within this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (13), or take 2d6+5 magic damage from the flames. On a success, they take half damage instead.
Quote3: “The ground glows red hot around you, suddenly bursting into flames.”
Text4: Spend a Fear to erupt in a fiery explosion. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Any you succeed against are thrown back to Far range and take 3d4+10 mag damage. Armor is half as effective against this damage.
Quote4: “A massive, fiery explosion rocks the battlefield.”

Name: Minor Treant
Description: An ambulatory sapling rising up to defend their forest.
Tactics: Crush, Overwhelm, Protect
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Minor Treants within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they each deal 4 phy damage.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Patchwork Zombie Hulk
Description: A towering gestalt of corpses moving as one, with torso-sized limbs and fists as large as a grown halfling.
Tactics: Hunger, Flail, Absorb Corpses, Terrify
Text1: Whenever Patchwork Zombie takes Major damage or worse, it marks +1 HP.
Quote1: “Your blows land harder than expected, limbs and torsos falling from the creature.”
Text2: When Patchwork Zombie Hulk makes an attack, it targets all opponents within Very Close range.
Quote2: “It attacks in every direction, torso-sized limbs flailing.”
Text3: If the Patchwork Zombie Hulk is within Very Close of a corpse, it presses the cadaver to itself and incorporates it into the Hulk’s form, healing 1 HP and clearing 1 Stress.
Quote3: “The hulk grabs the dead and swallows them, replacing some of its wounds and growing more energetic.”
Text4: Mark Stress to cause all PCs within Far range to make a reaction roll (Presence 13) or lose a Hope and add a token to the action tracker. PCs that succeed mark Stress instead.

Name: Petty Noble
Description: A richly-dressed and adorned aristocrat brimming with hubris.
Tactics: Gather Resources, Mobilize Minions, Abuse Power
Text1: All social actions against the Petty Noble on their land are made at disadvantage.
Quote1: “You’re a guest in my home!”
Text2: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon 1d4 Bladed Guards to enforce the Noble’s will.
Quote2: “You had no idea the suits of armor lining the hall were guards.”
Text3: Fear Petty Noble proclaims that a PC and their close associates are exiled from the noble’s territory. While exiled, the target has disadvantage in all social situations within the Noble’s domain.
Quote3: “Be gone!”

Name: Pirate Captain
Description: A charismatic sea dog with an impressive hat, eager to raid and plunder.
Tactics: Command, Raid, Plunder, Make ‘em Walk the Plank
Text1: Any incoming damage below 14 causes the attacker to mark a Stress.
Quote1: “You begin to realize: you might not win this fight.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to summon a Pirate Raiders Horde that enters at Far range. This can only be done once per scene.
Quote2: “The captain whistles, and more pirates pour out from the ship’s hold.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to choose a target who has more than two pirates within melee range of them. The Captain leads the pirates in hurling threats and promises of a watery grave. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll or suffer 1d4+1 Stress. They still mark a Stress on a success.
Quote3: “This is a battle of blades and of insults, it seems.”

Name: Pirate Raiders
Description: Seafaring scoundrels moving in a ravaging pack.
Tactics: Gang Up, Raid, Plunder
Text1: Any incoming damage below 11 causes the attacker to mark a Stress.
Quote1: “You begin to realize: you might not win this fight.”
Text2: If a Pirate Raider has marked 2 or more of its HP, they deal 2d4+3 phy instead of their normal damage.
Quote2: “With their numbers dwindling, they don’t pose as much of a threat.”

Name: Pirate Tough
Description: A thickly-muscled and tattooed pirate with melon-sized fists.
Tactics: Raid, Plunder, Smash, Terrorize
Text1: Any incoming damage below 15 causes the attacker to mark a Stress.
Quote1: “You begin to realize: you might not win this fight.”
Text2: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to move into melee with them and deal 2d6+10 damage. The target is then thrown back to a Close distance.
Quote2: “The ship rocks, sending you sprawling.”

Name: Red Ooze
Description: A moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.
Tactics: Ignite, Start Fires, Camouflage, Consume & Multiply
Text1: This adversary can only move Very Close range when it activates. It lights any flammable object it touches on fire.
Quote1: “It creeps towards you, the ground around it erupting into flames.”
Text2: Make an attack against a target in Very Close range. On a success, they burst into flames, taking 1d8+1 mag damage immediately and 2d4+2 direct magic damage every time a token is placed on the action tracker. This ends when they are extinguished with a Finesse Roll (14).
Quote2: “You feel fire at your feet, and suddenly, you’re engulfed.”
Text3: When this adversary marks its 3rd Hit Point, spend a Fear to split it into two Tiny Red Oozes (with no marked Hit Points or Stress). They may immediately activate without spending tokens.
Quote3: “You watch as the damage you’ve done splits it in half… becoming two oozes instead of one.”

Name: Rotted Zombie
Description: A decaying corpse ambling toward its prey.
Tactics: Hunger, Maul, Surround, Eat Flesh
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You hack through multiple bodies in the tight press of the undead.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Rotten Zombies within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “Though zombies move forward mindlessly, seeming to attack in a coordinated effort of instinct.”

Name: Sellsword
Description: An armed mercenary testing their luck.
Tactics: Charge, Overwhelm, Lacerate, Profit
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Sellswords within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Shambling Zombie
Description: An animated corpse that moves shakily, driven only by hunger.
Tactics: Hunger, Mob Enemy, Shred Flesh, Devour
Text1: If Shambling Zombie is in melee range with an opponent and at least one other Zombie is within Close range, all attacks against that opponent have advantage.
Quote1: “You no longer know where to look as more zombies surround you.”
Text2: When this creature deals hit point damage to a target, the target also marks Stress.
Quote2: “A cold shiver goes down your spine as you face off against the corpse of someone you knew.”

Name: Skeleton Archer
Description: A clattering pile of bones.
Tactics: Play Dead, Overwhelm, Fall Apart, Steal Skin
Text1: When two or more adversaries are very close to a target, all damage the archer deals to them is doubled.
Quote1: “Seeing their opportunity, they pull back and let loose an arrow.”
Text2: Make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 3d4+8 damage.
Quote2: “Their arrow finds you, exploiting your vulnerability to sink itself deep.”

Name: Skeleton Dredge
Description: A clattering pile of bones.
Tactics: Play Dead, Overwhelm, Fall Apart, Steal Skin
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Skeleton Dredges within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 3 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Skeleton Knight
Description: A dirt-covered skeleton armed with a rusted blade.
Tactics: Gang Up, Feign Death, Steal Skin
Text1: Mark a Stress to make a Rusty Greatsword attack against all enemies within Very Close range. Each target this succeeds against takes 2d8+5 phy and marks a Stress.
Quote1: “They swing their sword around them with unexpected power.”
Text2: When this adversary is killed, before it dies, it makes an attack against an enemy within Very Close range (prioritizing the enemy that killed it). On success, the target takes 3d4+8 phy damage and loses 1d4 Hope.
Quote2: “With its last moment of strength, the bone knight strikes out at you.”

Name: Skeleton Warrior
Description: A dirt-covered skeleton armed with a rusted blade.
Tactics: Gang Up, Feign Death, Steal Skin
Text1: This creature is resistant to physical damage.
Quote1: “Your weapon slides through their ribs, no skin to pierce. ”
Text2: After this adversary has marked its last hit point, you may still activate it to roll 1d6. On a 6, if there are any other adversaries still on the battlefield, this adversary reforms itself and returns to battle with no hit points marked.
Quote2: “The pile of bones reforms itself, rising up to fight again.”

Name: Spellblade
Description: A mercenary combining their skills in swordplay and magic to deadly effect.
Tactics: Blast, Command, Endure
Text1: Damage dealt by the Empowered Longsword is considered both physical and magic.
Quote1: “Their blade glows with an otherworldly sheen.”
Text2: Mark a Stress and target a group within Far range. They must make an Agility Reaction Roll or take 1d8+1 mag damage. Add a token to the action tracker for each target that marked HP on this attack.
Quote2: “The magical blast ricochets towards you, knocking the wind out of your lungs.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to activate the Spellblade and up to five allied units within Far range.
Quote3: “With sword raised high, they lead the charge towards you.”

Name: Swarm of Rats
Description: A skittering mass of ordinary rodents moving as one like a ravenous wave.
Tactics: Consume, Swarm, Obscure
Text1: All enemies in melee range of the swarm of rats have disadvantage on against any target other than the horde.
Quote1: “They swarm you, pulling your focus from anything but them.”
Text2: Once 4 HP are marked on the horde, they only do 1d4+2 on their Claws attack.
Quote2: “With their numbers dwindling, they don’t pose as much of a threat.”

Name: Sylvan Soldier
Description: A faerie warrior adorned in leaf & bark armor.
Tactics: Ambush, Overwhelm, Protect, Trail, Hide
Text1: When making a Scythe attack, if another Sylvan Soldier is also in melee range of the target, deal 2d8+5 phy damage instead.
Quote1: “When they work in packs, they’re more bold, more vicious.”
Text2: Spend a Fear to pull down a tree within Close range. Anyone the tree might hit on its way down must make an Agility Reaction (15) or take 3d4+11 phy damage.
Quote2: “They extend vines from their hands and pull the tree down with a crash.”
Text3: After a successful attack, mark a Stress to become Hidden until this adversary’s next attack or a PC makes an Instinct Roll (14) to find them.
Quote3: “When you look up from the attack, they are gone…”

Name: Tangle Bramble
Description: Individual blood-drinking tumbleweeds
Tactics: Drain, Entangle, Combine
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Tangle Brambles within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”
Text3: If an attack from Tangle Brambles deals HP and there are three or more Tangle Bramble Minions in Close range, combine all Tangle Bramble minions into a Tangle Bramble Swarm with HP equal to the number of minions combined.

Name: Tangle Bramble Swarm
Description: A cluster of animate, blood-drinking tumbleweeds, each the size of a large gourd.
Tactics: Entangle, Immobilize, Digest
Text1: Whenever Tangle Bramble Swarm hits a PC, give them a bramble token. If a creature has any bramble tokens when they activate, they add an additional token to the action tracker when they take an action. If a creature has 3 or more bramble tokens, they are Restrained. Bramble tokens can be removed by making a Finesse roll (12 + the number of bramble tokens) or dealing Major damage to Tangle Bramble Swarm. If removed without damage, create a Tangle Bramble Minion in Melee with the now-freed character for each token removed.
Quote1: “The brambles grab a hold of you, digging in and slowing your movement.”
Text2: Mark Stress to deal 2d6+8 phy direct damage to a target with 3 or more bramble tokens.
Quote2: “The brambles dig into you, blood draining into the vegetable matter.”
Text3: If Tangle Brambles has 3 or more of their Hit Points marked, their attack only deals 1d4+2 damage.
Quote3: “With their numbers dwindling, they don’t pose as much of a threat.”

Name: Tiny Green Ooze
Description: A small moving mound of translucent green slime.
Tactics: Creep up, Envelop, Camouflage, Consume & Multiply
Text1: Any successful melee attacks this creature makes also marks an Armor Slot on the target. This doesn’t reduce any damage.
Quote1: “The residue eats away at your armor, corroding it slowly.”

Name: Tiny Red Ooze
Description: A small moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.
Tactics: Blaze, Camouflage, Consume & Multiply
Text1: Any creature that damages this adversary from melee range takes 2d6 direct magic damage.
Quote1: “As you strike the ooze, you feel a flash of red hot heat wash over you.”

Name: Weaponmaster
Description: A clear serpent with a head the size of a human that leaves behind a glass shard trail wherever it goes.
Tactics: Climb, Feed, Keep Distance, Scare
Text1: Make a Greatsword attack and mark a Stress to taunt the target. The next time the taunted target acts, if they attack anyone other than the Weaponmaster, its with disadvantage.
Quote1: “They smile at you with venom in their eyes. ‘Come get me.’”
Text2: Spend a Fear once per scene to heal 2 HP and 2 Stress.
Quote2: “They wipe the blood from their face and look up at you, revelling in the challenge.”

Name: Young Dryad
Description: An imperious tree-person leading their forest’s defenses.
Tactics: Command, Nurture, Prune the Unwelcome
Text1: Mark a Stress to activate 1d4 allies in range of a target they can immediately hit. Their attacks deal half damage.
Quote1: “When they work in packs, they’re more bold, more vicious.”
Text2: Spend a Fear to form a cage around a target within Very Close range that makes them Restrained. Any action taken against the cage marks a Stress. The target can be broken free with a successful Strength Roll.
Quote2: “A cage of thorns and vines wraps around you, holding you in place.”

Name: Zombie Pack
Description: A group of shambling corpses instinctively moving together.
Tactics: Hunger, Maul, Consume Flesh
Text1: When a creature within melee range deals 1 HP to the Zombie Pack, you may mark a Stress to have the Zombie Pack immediately make an attack against that creature.
Quote1: “The zombie's numbers seem insurmountable.”
Text2: If the Zombie Pack has 3 or more of their Hit Points marked, their attack only deals 2d4+3 damage.
Quote2: “With their numbers dwindling, they don’t post as much of a threat.”

Name: Apprentice Assassin
Description: A dirt-covered skeleton armed with a rusted blade.
Tactics: Gang Up, Feign Death, Steal Skin
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Apprentice Assassins within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Archer Squadron
Description: A group of trained archers bearing massive bows.
Tactics: Volley Fire, Stick Together, Survive
Text1: Pick a point within a Far distance. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within a Close distance of that point. Targets that are hit suffer 2d10+4 phy damage.
Quote1: “Their arrows fill the air, blocking out light as they rain death upon you.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to target a point within a Far distance. Until the next roll with Fear, any character that moves within Close of that point must make a Reaction Roll (Agility 13) or suffer 2d6+13 physical damage. On a success, they take half damage.
Quote2: “They concentrate their attention on a single point, loosing on anyone that approaches.”
Text3: If Archer Squadron has marked ½ or more of their HP, their basic attack deals 2d6+3 phy instead of 2d6+13 phy.
Quote3: “With their numbers flagging, the archers’ attacks are weaker.”

Name: Assassin Poisoner
Description: A cunning scoundrel skilled in both poisons and ambushing.
Tactics: Anticipate, Taint Food and Water, Disable, Get Paid
Text1: Targets that mark HP from a Poisoned Throwing Dagger attack are made Vulnerable until they clear one Hit Point.
Quote1: “Your wound stings as poison courses through your body.”
Text2: Assassin Poisoner has advantage on attacks if they are Hidden.
Quote2: “They come at you from your flank, and you barely have time to react.”
Text3: Drop a smoke bomb that fills the area within Close range with smoke, making all targets Dizzied. Dizzied characters add two tokens to the action tracker when they act, then are no longer dizzied.
Quote3: “They throw something, and the air fills with a thick, cloying smoke.”

Name: Battle Box
Description: A cube-shaped construct with a different rune on each of their six sides.
Tactics: Wait in Disguise, Trample Foes, Change Tactics
Text1: This adversary may activate twice in a GM move.
Quote1: “They move with incredible speed.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to add +1d10 to the damage of any of the Battle Box’s attacks.
Quote2: “The box glows and rattles, unleashing a powerful attack.”
Text3: Mark Stress and roll 1d6. The Battle Box uses the corresponding move. 1. Mana Beam The cube turns and fires a searing beam. Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, deal 2d10+10mag damage. 2. Fire Jets The cube shoots into the air, spinning as it releases jets of flame. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Any you succeed against take 2d6+3 phy damage. 3. Trample The cube rockets around a Close area, attacking all within. Any it is successful against take 2d8+10 physical damage and are Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. 4. Shocking Gas The cube sprays out a silver gas sparking with lightning. All creatures within Close range must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or mark 3 Stress. 5. Stunning Clap The cube leaps and its sides clap, creating a small sonic boom. Any targets within Very Close range must make a Strength Reaction Roll or become Vulnerable until this adversary is defeated. 6. Psionic Whine The cube releases a cluster of mechanical bees whose buzz rattles mortal minds. All targets within Close range must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 2d8+10 mag damage that can’t be reduced by armor.
Quote3: “The box jumps and spins, and unleashes a different attack depending on the side that landed face-up.”
Text4: When this adversary marks its last Hit Point, the magic powering it ruptures in an explosion of force. All targets in Close range make an Instinct Reaction Roll or take 2d8+12 magic damage.

Name: Chaos Skull
Description: A bleached floating humanoid skull animated by scintillating magic.
Tactics: Serve Creator, Cackle, Consume Magic
Text1: Chaos Skull levitates several feet off the ground and can’t be Restrained.
Quote1: “The skull floats at eye-level and slips out of your grasp.”
Text2: Chaos Skull is resistant to magic damage.
Quote2: “The skull absorbs part of your magic, the attack landing without the force you’d expect.”
Text3: Mark Stress to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Each target you succeed against takes 2d10+4 mag damage.
Quote3: “Power bursts from the skull, searing and chilling and shocking you all at once.”
Text4: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, a target with a Spellcast trait marks 1d4 Stress and the Chaos Skull clears that many Stress. Additionally, on a success, Chaos Skull may immediately activate again without spending action tokens.
Quote4: “The skull cackles in a hollow voice, and you feel the magical power within slipping away from you and feeding the skull.”

Name: Conscript
Description: Poorly-trained civilians pressed into war.
Tactics: Follow Orders, Gang Up, Survive
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Conscripts within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Courtesan
Description: An accomplished manipulator and master of the sensual arts.
Tactics: Entice, Maneuver, Secure Patrons
Text1: Mark a Stress when a character within Close distance makes a roll with Presence. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16). If they fail, they mark 2 Stress and are Vulnerable for the remainder of the scene until they succeed on a social action against the Courtesan. If they succeed, they still mark Stress.
Quote1: “Just as you make your point, they tear you apart with a tiny scoff.”
Text2: Spend a Fear to subvert a character, convincing them to do something they want to do even if they know it’s a bad idea. If used on an NPC, it just works unless it would violate their motive. If used on a PC, the PC must make a React roll with Presence (16). If they fail, they can do as the Courtesan asks or mark 2 Stress. If they succeed, they still mark Stress. This subversion is often, but not always, romantic or physical.

Name: Cult Adept
Description: An experienced mage wielding shadow and fear.
Tactics: Uncover Knowledge, Hinder Foes, Curry Favor
Text1: When a PC rolls a failure with Fear, clear a Stress. Usable up to twice per scene.
Quote1: “As the fight grows more desperate, the Adept seems refreshed.”
Text2: Make a standard attack. On a success, mark a Stress to cause the target to mark Stress in addition to the normal results.
Quote2: “The blast ripples across your body as you writhe in pain.”
Text3: Mark a Stress to wrap an ally within Close distance in a shroud of protection. While so protected, the target has resistance to all damage.
Quote3: “They conjure a dark cloud of concentrated magical shadow, which blunts some of the strength of your attacks.”
Text4: Spend a Fear and choose a point within Far range. All targets within Close range of that point are bound up in smoky chains and become temporarily Restrained. Each time they act while within the target area, they add two action tokens to the action tracker, not one. They can break free of the restraints with a Strength roll or by spending 2 Hope.
Quote4: “Thick chains of smoke wrap themselves around you, binding you in place.”

Name: Cult Fang
Description: A professional killer-turned-cultist.
Tactics: Isolate Prey, Capture Sacrifices, Rise in the Ranks
Text1: Cult Fang can climb and walk on vertical surfaces. Mark a Stress to move from one shadow to another within a Far distance.
Quote1: “The Fang moves as if one with the darkness around them.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to move up to a Close distance and attack. The target must make a Reaction Roll (Instinct 15) or mark 2 Stress and be teleported with the Cult Fang to a shadow within a Far distance. If the target succeeds, they still mark Stress due to visions of the dread realm between shadows.
Quote2: “They leap out from a shadow to grab you and pull you away with them.”

Name: Cult Initiate
Description: A Low-ranking cultist in simple robes, eager to gain power.
Tactics: Follow Orders, Gain Power, Seek Forbidden Knowledge
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Cult Initiates within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Demonic Hound Pack
Description: Unnatural hounds with ichor-slicked fur.
Tactics: Consume Flesh, Please Masters, Cause Fear
Text1: May leap up to a Close distance when moving as part of an activation.
Quote1: “They bound forward, clearing gaps and obstacles in pursuit of prey.”
Text2: Mark Stress to cause all targets within a Very Close distance to lose Hope. If not able to lose a Hope, they mark 2 Stress.
Quote2: “They let loose a howl that tears at your heart.”
Text3: If Demonic Hound Pack has half or more of its HP marked, their basic attack deals 2d4+6 phy damage instead of 2d8+12 phy.
Quote3: “With their numbers dwindling, they don’t pose as much of a threat.”

Name: Electric Eels
Description: A pack of eels that encircle and electrocute.
Tactics: Avoid Larger Predators, Shock Prey, Tear Apart
Text1: Mark Stress to attack all targets within Very Close distance. Add one token to the action tracker for each target that marks HP.
Quote1: “The electricity courses through you, slowing your actions.”
Text2: If Electric Eels have marked ½ or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 2d4+4d phy damage instead of 2d10+4.
Quote2: “With their numbers dwindling, they don’t pose as much of a threat.”

Name: Elite Soldier
Description: An armored squire or experienced commoner looking to advance.
Tactics: Gain Glory, Make Alliances, Support Their Knight
Text1: When a Knight or other noble would take damage, if the Elite Soldier is within Very Close range of the noble, mark a Stress and the Elite Soldier moves into melee to take the damage instead.
Quote1: “They leap to their liege’s defense, throwing their body on your blow.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to move up to a Close distance to melee range of an ally. Make an attack against a very close target. On a success, deal 2d10+10 phy damage and clear a Stress on that Close ally.
Quote2: “The soldier runs up to join the fight, stabbing with ferocity and bolstering their ally.”

Name: Failed Experiment
Description: A magical experiment in necromancy gone wrong, leaving the zombie warped and ungainly.
Tactics: Devour, Hunt, Track
Text1: This creature is resistant to physical damage.
Quote1: “The dead flesh has grown tough, less responsive to your weapons.”
Text2: When a target this adversary is attacking has any allies also in Very Close range, Failed Experiment’s damage is doubled.
Quote2: “The creature shuffles around to your flank, retaining some sense of tactics as it attacks where you’re weak.”
Text3: Mark a Stress to activate Failed Experiment even if they have already activated this move.
Quote3: “It leaps forward, its movements sharp and jolting like a puppet on strings.”

Name: Giant Beastmaster
Description: A leather-clad warrior bearing a whip and massive bow.
Tactics: Command, Maneuver, Pin Down, Make a Living, Protect Companion Animals
Text1: Make a Longbow attack against a target. On a success, the Beastmaster may also mark a Stress to pin them to a nearby surface. A pinned target is Restrained until freed with a Finesse or Strength Roll (16).
Quote1: “Their arrow punches through you and pins you to the nearby terrain.”
Text2: Up to twice per scene, summon a Bear, Dire Wolf, or similar Tier 0 Beast under this adversary’s control. That beast appears at a Close range and immediately activates.
Quote2: “They blow a whistle and a trained beast emerges, charging forward at the giant’s command.”
Text3: When this adversary activates, you can also activate a Tier 0 Beast currently under this adversary’s control.
Quote3: “The beast and giant move in perfect sync, closing in together.”

Name: Giant Brawler
Description: An especially-muscular giant wielding a warhammer larger than a tall human.
Tactics: Overwhelm, Slam, Topple, Make a Living
Text1: When the Giant Brawler marks two or more HP, immediately make a Warhammer attack against the attacker, if they are within range. On a success, the target takes 2d6+15 phy damage.
Quote1: “As soon as your blow has landed, they swing their hammer down at you in response.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to have this adversary charge at an inanimate object within Close range they could feasibly smash (a wall, a cart, a market stand, etc.) and destroy it. Any targets in Very Close range of the object must make an Agility Reaction Roll (16) or take 2d4+3 phy damage from the shrapnel.
Quote2: “The giant charges, shattering everything in their way.”

Name: Giant Eagle
Description: A giant-sized bird of prey with blood-stained talons.
Tactics: Hunt Prey, Strike Decisively, Stay Mobile
Text1: Giant Eagle’s Difficulty is +3 when flying.
Quote1: “The eagle soars and swoops with incredible agility.”
Text2: Mark Stress to attack a target within Far range. On a success, the target takes 2d10+10 damage and is knocked over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.
Quote2: “The eagle narrows itself into a feathered javelin, tearing through the sky before opening up and raking you with their claws.”
Text3: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target takes 2d4+3 phy damage and must make an Agility Reaction Roll or become Restrained within the eagle’s massive talons. If they are Restrained, the Eagle immediately lifts into the air to Very Far range above the battlefield while holding them. A Restrained target may make a Strength roll to escape.
Text4: If the Eagle is holding a Restrained target and flying, they can drop them. This means the target is no longer Restrained, but they are falling. If their fall is not prevented by some means on the next action the PCs take, the target will suffer 2d20 phy damage.

Name: Giant Recruit
Description: A giant fighter wearing borrowed armor.
Tactics: Overwhelm, Batter, Terrify, Make a Living
Text1: Choose a target and activate all Giant Recruits within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 6 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote1: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Gorgon
Description: A snake-headed scaled humanoid with a glowing bow, enraged that their piece has been disturbed.
Tactics: Corner, Hit-and-Run, Seek Vengeance, Petrify
Text1: This adversary may activate twice in a GM move.
Quote1: “They move with incredible speed.”
Text2: Targets damaged by Sunsear Shortbow give off bright light within a Close distance until the end of the scene and cannot become Hidden without a magical effect. All attack rolls against a target glowing this way are made with advantage.
Text3: Make an attack roll against a target in melee range using this adversary’s protective snakes. On a success, mark stress to deal 2d10+4 phy damage to the target, who must also mark a Stress.
Text4: Spend a Fear when the Gorgon takes damage from an attack within Close range to force the attacker to make a Reaction roll with Instinct (15). On a failure, they begin to turn to stone, marking 1 hit point of direct damage and starting a petrification Countdown (4). This countdown ticks down every time the Gorgon is attacked. When triggered, the target must make a death move. If the Gorgon is killed, all Petrification countdowns end.

Name: Juvenile Flickerfly
Description: A horse-sized insect with iridescent scales and crystalline wings moving faster than the eye can see.
Tactics: Collect Shiny Things, Hunt, Swoop
Text1: Flickerfly may activate three times in one GM move (still costs 3 action tokens).
Quote1: “The Flickerfly is everywhere at once, moving with uncanny speed.”
Text2: Before an attack the Juvenile Flickerfly makes, roll 1d6. On a 4+, the target's Evasion score is halved (rounded up).
Quote2: “The Flickerfly moves so fast that you’re on the back foot as you try to evade.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of its targets. All creatures within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target adds a token to the action tracker and the Flickerfly learns a fear the target has.
Quote3: “Their shimmering wings catch the light and flash, enrapturing you and surfacing deep-seeded fears.”
Text4: Countdown (Loop 1d6) Activate the first time the Flickerfly takes damage. When triggered, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. On a failure, the target marks a Stress and loses a Hope.
Quote4: “The gas seeps in and your vision fills with terrifying visions that shake your confidence.”

Name: Katari Burglar
Description: A cunning thief with acrobatic skill and a flair for the dramatic.
Tactics: Hide, Profit, Pilfer, Evade
Text1: Make a claw attack against a target in Melee range. On a success, deal 1d8+2 phy damage and this adversary steals one item or consumable from the target’s inventory.
Quote1: “The Katari swipes at you with their claws, and when their paw comes away, they’ve stolen something from your pouch. They flash you a satisfied smile.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to reveal a snare trap set by the Katari Burglar. All targets within Very Close range of the trap must make an Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be pulled off their feet and suspended upside down. They are Vulnerable and Restrained until they get free with a Finesse or Strength Roll (13).
Quote2: “A snare snaps closed on you and flips you upside down. The Katari gives you a mocking wave as they make their escape.”

Name: Knight of the Realm
Description: A well-built soldier with heavy armor and a powerful bearing.
Tactics: Seek Glory, Show Dominance, Run Down
Text1: Knight of the Realm has +2 difficulty when mounted. If they suffer Severe damage, they’re knocked from their mount and lose this benefit until they spend an action to re-mount.
Quote1: “They’re a skilled rider and know how to use the mount’s speed and strength.”
Text2: When the Knight of the Realm marks physical damage, reduce it by 3.
Quote2: “Their heavy armor diminishes the strength of your blows.”
Text3: If mounted, move up to a close distance and make an attack against a target within very close distance. On a success, deal 2d8+12 phy damage and the target marks Stress.
Quote3: “They bear down on you, lance seeking your heart as the steed thunders forward.”
Text4: Mark a Stress to activate 1d4+1 allies. Any attacks they make in these activations deal half damage.
Quote4: “Their voice rings loud and clear, and their soldiers follow with vigor.”

Name: Master Assassin
Description: A seasoned killer with a threatening voice and a deadly blade.
Tactics: Ambush, Command, Dispatch, Profit
Text1: Armor is half as effective against attacks made while Master Assassin is Hidden.
Quote1: “Attacking from stealth, their attack finds the gaps in your armor.”
Text2: Mark a Stress to activate a number of Assassins equal to the Master Assassin’s unmarked Stress.
Quote2: “Their leader whistles, and a group of assassins act as one with practiced grace.”
Text3: When Master Assassin successfully makes a Serrated Dagger attack against a character that is Vulnerable, spend a Fear to deal 3 Hit Points instead of rolling.
Quote3: “Their eyes go black as the attack comes in, and the blade appears in your side, stabbing deep and ignoring your armor.”

Name: Merchant Baron
Description: An accomplished merchant with a large operation under their command.
Tactics: Abuse Power, Gather Resources, Mobilize Minions
Text1: If Merchant Baron knows a target’s motive, Spend a Fear to offer a target a dangerous bargain. If used on a PC, they must make a Reaction Roll with Presence (17). If they fail, they can mark 2 Stress or take the deal.
Quote1: “The baron’s eyes glimmer as they make you an offer you dare not resist.”
Text2: Countdown (Loop 6) Activate when Merchant Baron first becomes relevant to the story. When triggered, spies learn the motive of a target character (NPC or PC).
Quote2: “The merchant baron has agents throughout the land, scouring for the most valuable commodity: leverage.”
Feature3: The Best Muscle Money Can Buy
Text3: Once per scene, mark Stress to summon 1d4+1 Tier I guards to enforce the Merchant Baron’s will. They appear at a Far distance.
Quote3: “The Baron snaps, and a group of rough-looking toughs emerge from the back room.”

Name: Minotaur
Description: A massive bull-headed Firbolg with a quick temper.
Tactics: Gore, Overpower, Pursue, Navigate, Consume
Text1: This adversary costs 2 action tokens to activate.
Quote1: “The enemy moves slowly, but with incredible strength.”
Text2: Spend a Fear to make an attack roll on a group within Very Close range. The Minotaur charges through them, making an attack. Any they succeed against are knocked back to Close range and take 2d10+10 phy damage. If they are knocked into a solid object or another creature, they take an additional 1d8+3 phy (add the damage together).
Quote2: “The Minotaur lowers their head and charges, knocking you back with incredible force.”
Text3: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range, moving the Minotaur into melee with them. On a success, deal 2d6+15 phy damage to the target. Armor is only worth half its value against this attack.
Quote3: “The Minotaur slashes and stabs with their huge horns, punching through your armor.”

Name: Mortal Hunter
Description: An undead figure wearing a heavy leather coat, with searching eyes and a casually cruel demeanor.
Tactics: Devour, Hunt, Track
Text1: Every time this creature makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose one Hope.
Quote1: “They strike you with silent satisfaction, and their claws rend more than flesh as your confidence sinks.”
Text2: Spend a Fear to put a deathlock on a target within Very Close range as the Mortal Hunter binds the target with a necrotic curse. Any attacks made by the Mortal Hunter on a deathlocked target deal direct damage. This creature can only maintain one deathlock at a time.
Quote2: “They make a pattern with their hands and a sigil burns into you as it feels like something has wrapped cold hands around your heart.”
Text3: Mark Stress to activate 1d4 adversaries under the Mortal Hunter’s control. They deal half damage with any attacks made in these activations.
Quote3: “The Hunter snaps, and the dead around you leap into action.”
Text4: Countdown (Loop 1d6) Activate when a hostile target is spotted. When triggered, move in a straight line to somewhere in Far range, and make an attack with a +3 modifier against all enemies in the path. Deal 2d8+12 physical damage to any you succeed against.
Quote4: “Hatred burns in their eyes, and they shoot forward with a blur, tearing through everything in their path.”

Name: Royal Advisor
Description: A high-ranking courtier with the ear of the local nobility.
Tactics: Curry Favor, Manufacture Evidence, Scheme
Text1: Any PC that rolls less than 17 on a social action against the Royal Advisor marks a Stress.
Quote1: “The courtier laughs and says, ‘I’m sure you think so, darling, but the rest of us live in the real world.’”
Text2: Mark a Stress to influence a NPC within Very Close distance with whispered words. That noble’s opinion on one matter shifts toward the Royal Advisor’s preference unless it is direct opposition to the target’s motives.
Quote2: “They lean in to whisper in the count’s ears, and you can see them changing their mind before your eyes.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to convince a target crowd or notable individual that one person or group is responsible for some problem facing the target. The target becomes hostile to the scapegoat until convinced of their innocence (Presence 17).
Quote3: “They’ve blamed you for the crime, and everyone has bought the lie.”

Name: Secret-Keeper
Description: A cell leader with a direct channel to the Fallen Gods, wearing fine robes and wielding an ancient staff.
Tactics: Amass Greater Power, Take Command, Plot in Secret
Text1: When the GM activates an ally within Far distance, Secret-Keeper may Mark Stress to add a token to the action tracker.
Quote1: “The Secret-Keeper’s voice carries the weight of dread, chilling your blood.”
Text2: Spend a Fear to activate 1d4 allies to attack. Their attacks deal half damage.
Quote2: “When they call, the cultists answer, swarming to attack.”
Text3: Countdown (6) Activate when a hostile target is spotted. When triggered, summon a Minor Demon within a Close distance. Each time Secret-Keeper marks HP, add the number of HP marked to this Countdown.
Quote3: “Their leader’s hands glow with eerie light, chanting a ritual of summoning. Whatever they’re calling out to, it’s not good.”
Text4: Once per scene, when Secret-Keeper takes Major or worse damage, mark a Stress to summon a Demonic Hound Pack. They appear at a Close distance and immediately activate (no token required).
Quote4: “The Secret-Keeper reels from the blow, then throws a sulfurous pouch to the ground. From it springs a pack of monstrous hounds, eager for the hunt.”

Name: Shark
Description: A large aquatic predator, always on the move.
Tactics: Isolate Prey, Capture Sacrifices, Rise in the Ranks
Text1: Armor is half as effective against damage from Shark’s attacks.
Quote1: “The Shark’s teeth tear through your armor.”
Text2: When an enemy within Close distance of Shark marks HP from an attack by another creature, the Shark may spend Stress to immediately activate to move and attack that target.
Quote2: “The Shark senses wounded prey and closes in to finish you off.”

Name: Siren
Description: A half-fish person with a shimmering scales and an irresistible voice.
Tactics: Lure Prey, Subdue with Song, Consume
Text1: Spend a Fear to sing a song that affects all non-Siren creatures within Close distance. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll (14) or become entranced. Other Sirens within a Close range of the target can mark Stress to increase the difficulty of this roll by +1 each. While entranced, a target cannot act and is Vulnerable. A character may mark 2 Stress to free themselves from this effect.
Quote1: “Their song tugs at your soul, promising an end to all your troubles through sweet oblivion.”
Text2: If Siren attacks a target entranced by their song, the target takes 2d10+10 damage instead of normal damage.
Quote2: “Incapacitated by the song, the Siren tears into you with incredible ferocity.”

Name: Spectral Archer
Description: A ghostly fighter with an ethereal bow, unable to move on while their charge is vulnerable.
Tactics: Rehash Old Battles, Protect Treasure, Move Through Solid Objects
Text1: Spectral Archer has resistance to physical damage and may mark a Stress to move a Close distance through solid objects (walls, people, etc.).
Quote1: “Their translucent form passes through solid objects like a hand through water.”
Text2: +1 attack modifier Mark a Stress to make an attack within Far distance that is in melee with at least two allies. On a success, the target takes 2d8+12 phy damage.
Quote2: “They’ve forgotten their lives, but they remember how to find a good shot and take it.”

Name: Spectral Captain
Description: A ghostly commander leading their troops beyond death.
Tactics: Rally Troops, Rehash Old Battles, Move Through Solid Objects
Text1: Spectral Captain has resistance to physical damage and may mark a Stress to move a Close distance through solid objects (walls, people, etc.).
Quote1: “Their translucent form passes through solid objects like a hand through water.”
Text2: When Spectral allies are forced to make a Reaction roll, mark Stress to give all of them a +2 modifier on that roll.
Quote2: “The captain bolsters their troops with words, helping them weather your attacks.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to return up to 1d4+1 ‘killed’ Spectral allies to the battle in the location where they first appeared. They have all Stress/HP cleared.
Quote3: “The commander calls for reinforcements, and the same ghosts you’ve already defeated re-appear without a scratch on them.”

Name: Spectral Guardian
Description: A ghostly fighter with spears and swords, anchored by duty.
Tactics: Rehash Old Battles, Protect Treasure, Move Through Solid Objects
Text1: Spectral Guardian has resistance to physical damage and may mark a Stress to move a Close distance through solid objects (walls, people, etc.).
Quote1: “Their translucent form passes through solid objects like a hand through water.”
Text2: +0 attack modifier Make an attack against a target within very close range. On a success, deal 2d10+6 phy damage and the target must mark Stress.
Quote2: “Their blades slash and stab and the wounds they leave run cold like ice.”

Name: Spy
Description: A skilled espionage agent with a knack for being in the right place to overhear secrets.
Tactics: Abuse Power, Gather Resources, Mobilize Minions
Text1: Mark a Stress when something sensitive is discussed to reveal that the Spy is present in a scene observing a character or group. The PC with the highest Instinct or best chance to notice the Spy makes an Instinct Reaction Roll (17) to notice the Spy. If they fail, they can mark Stress to know that they’re being observed but not where the Spy is.
Text2: Spend a Fear to describe how the Spy knows a secret about a target character in the scene. If the target is a PC, they may mark 2 Stress to suggest a lesser secret that the Spy learned instead.

Name: Stonewraith
Description: A cousin of a mountain lion, with a slate-gray stone body.
Tactics: Stalk Through Stone, Isolate Prey, Defend Territory
Text1: Stonewraith can move through stone and earth as if it was sand/rough terrain. They only need to surface air once every twenty minutes and use Stonesense to identify pockets of air in tunnels and the surface.
Quote1: “The beast leaps into the stone wall like it was merely sand.”
Text2: Mark a Stress as Stonewraith leaps from within stone/earth to attack a target. The target must make an Agility or Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take 2d8+12 phy damage and become temporarily Vulnerable until they take their next action.
Quote2: “They burst from the wall to tackle you to the floor and rend you with their teeth.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to roar and cause a cave-in. All targets within Close must make an Agility (14) Reaction Roll or suffer 2d10+10 phy damage. The rubble can be cleared with a Completion Countdown (8).
Quote3: “Their voice resonates with the stone. The ceiling cracks and comes tumbling down all around you.”

Name: War Wizard
Description: A battle-hardened mage trained in destructive magic.
Tactics: Develop New Spells, Shatter Formations, Seek Power
Text1: War Wizard may mark Stress to teleport to a location within a Far distance before or after making a basic attack.
Quote1: “They pop in and out, nearly impossible to pin down.”
Text2: When War Wizard takes damage from an attack within Close range, the attacker takes 2d4+3 magic damage. On a result of 10+, this ability deactivates until War Wizard marks Stress to reactivate it.
Quote2: “Part of the force of your blow reflects back on you.”
Text3: Mark Stress and choose a point within a Far range. A Very Close area around that point erupts into impassable terrain. Anyone within that area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (14) or be thrown back by a Close distance and take 2d10+4 physical damage. Targets that succeed are not moved and take half damage.
Quote3: “The Wizard points and the ground detonates, throwing you back.”
Text4: Spend a Fear to unleash a precise hail of magical blasts. Every opponent within Far range takes 2d10+10 magic damage. Characters may make an Agility Reaction Roll (15) to take half damage.
Quote4: “They raise their staff and call down a hailstorm of magical bolts.”

Name: Adult Flickerfly
Description: A winged insect the size of a large house with iridescent scales and wings that move too fast to track.
Tactics: Collect Shiny Things, Hunt, Swoop, Nest
Text1: Flickerfly may activate three times in one GM move (still costs 3 action tokens).
Quote1: “The Flickerfly moves with incredible speed, striking like the wind.”
Text2: All Evasion scores are halved (rounded up) against the Adult Flickerfly.
Quote2: “The Flickerfly moves so fast that you’re on the back foot as you try to evade.”
Text3: Flickerfly may move up to Far range as part of an activation while flying.
Quote3: “Their glowing wings buzz as the Flickerfly darts around the battlefield.”
Text4: Make a spin attack, slashing at all Very Close targets. On any you succeed against, deal 2d10+6 physical damage. Armor is only half as effective when reducing this damage.
Quote4: “The Flickerfly spins, wings slashing all around it in an intricate pattern.”
Text5: Spend a Fear to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of its targets. All creatures within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target adds a token to the action tracker and the Flickerfly learns a fear the target has.
Quote5: “Their shimmering wings catch the light and flash, enrapturing you and surfacing deep-seeded fears.”
Text6: Countdown (Loop 1d6) Activate the first time the Flickerfly takes damage. When triggered, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll (17) or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. On a failure, the target loses 2 Hope and takes 3d8+3 mag damage that cannot be reduced by armor.
Quote6: “The gas seeps in and your vision fills with terrifying visions that shake your confidence.”
Text7: Flickerfly may mark Stress when taking damage from an attack within Close range to only take half damage (rounded up).
Quote7: “The Flickerfly starts to dodge your attack almost before you’ve begun to make your attack.”

Name: Demon of Avarice
Description: A regal cloaked monstrosity with circular horns adorned with treasure.
Tactics: Consume, Sow Dissent, Fuel Avarice, Stick and Move
Text1: All attacks against Demon of Greed are made at disadvantage unless the attacker spends a handful of gold. When a character marks HP from an attack by Demon of Avarice, they can spend a bag of gold instead of marking HP (1 bag per HP). Add a gold token to Demon of Avarice for each handful or bag of gold spent by PCs on this feature.
Quote1: “The demon taunts you, saying that you must pay for the privilege of fighting it on fair terms.”
Text2: Always add a bonus to Demon of Greed’s attacks equal to the number of gold tokens it has.
Quote2: “As it accumulates wealth, the demon’s attacks are becoming more powerful.”
Text3: Spend 3 gold tokens (or a Fear) to activate 1d4+1 allies, including allies that have already activated this GM turn.
Quote3: “Some of the demon’s gold disintegrates and their allies leap into action.”

Name: Demon of Despair
Description: A cloaked demon-creature on stilt-limbs, seeping shadows.
Tactics: Make Fear Contagious, Stick to the Shadows, Undermine Resolve
Text1: Demon of Despair deals double damage to a PC with 0 Hope.
Quote1: “Bereft of hope, the demon's blows cut you to the quick.”
Text2: When a PC fails with Fear, mark Stress to cause all other PCs within a Close distance to lose a Hope.
Quote2: “The demon’s voice echoes in your ears, pushing you to doubt your comrades.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to weigh down the spirits of all within a Far range. All targets affected replace their Hope die with a d8 until they roll a success with Hope or take a rest.
Quote3: “The demon’s miasma fills your senses, choking your heart. Your chances of victory seem much dimmer.”

Name: Demon of Hubris
Description: A perfectly beautiful and infinitely cruel huge humanoid with a gleaming spear and elegant robes.
Tactics: Condescend, Declare Premature Victory, Prove Superiority
Text1: Mark a Stress to make an attack that automatically hits.
Quote1: “The demon snarls as they push themselves to perfect action, their blow landing with unmatched skill.”
Text2: Spend a Fear to activate any 2 Emotion Demons within Far range, even if they have activated this GM move.
Quote2: “The Demon cheers on their allies, hubris driving each of them to greater feats.”
Text3: Whenever a character fails a roll within Close distance of Demon of Hubris, they mark a Stress.
Quote3: “The demon taunts you for your inadequacy, critiquing your form with cruel precision.”
Text4: When a character fails a roll, they may choose to re-roll their Fear die and take the new result. If they fail, they mark 2 Stress and Demon of Hubris clears a Stress.
Quote4: “The demon’s intensity drives you to perfection, at a terrible cost.”

Name: Demon of Jealousy
Description: A fickle creature of spindly limbs and insatiable desires.
Tactics: Take What Belongs to Others, Join in on Others’ Success
Text1: Armor may not be used against damage from Demon of Jealousy’s Psychic Assault attacks.
Quote1: “The demon’s presence attacks your mind directly, lashing at you with covetous thoughts about your friends’ treasures.”
Text2: Mark a Stress when a PC uses a domain ability, class feature, or subclass feature. Demon of Jealousy may use this ability for the rest of the scene, paying Stress for any Hope costs. Demon of Jealousy may only have one move copied at a time.
Quote2: “The demon cackles with glee after your maneuver as it duplicates what you’ve just done, turning it back on the party.”
Text3: Mark Stress when an opponent within a Close range takes damage to have Demon of Jealousy add 2d4+3 damage to the total.
Quote3: “The demon curses at their ally, demanding to be the one to bring you down.”
Text4: When a PC takes Severe or worse damage within Very Close range of the Demon of Jealousy, they must make a Finesse (17) reaction roll. If they fail, the Demon of Jealousy seizes one item from their burden or inventory. It may then use that item by marking Stress as per Me Too! Demon of Jealousy may not use consumables in this manner.
Quote4: “The demon whips out a spindly limb and grabs something from your pack, dancing as it holds it up to its gleaming eyes.”

Name: Demon of Wrath
Description: A hulking demon with boulder-sized fists, driven by endless rage.
Tactics: Fuel Anger, Impress Rivals, Wreak Havoc
Text1: When a character marks armor to reduce damage from Demon of Wrath’s attacks, their armor is only half as effective.
Quote1: “The demons’ fury powers their blows, tearing through your armor..”
Text2: Mark Stress when Demon of Wrath takes damage from a target within Close damage to make an immediate basic attack against them.
Quote2: “Incensed by your blow, the demon slashes back at you.”
Text3: Spend a Fear to boil the blood of all targets within a Far range. For the rest of the scene, they use a d20 as their Fear die instead of a d12.
Quote3: “The demon roars, and something within your heart answers. You feel the pull to fight, to kill. That anger threatens to overtake you.”
Text4: Countdown (Loop 6) Activate this countdown the first time an attack is made within sight of the Demon of Wrath. This Countdown only reduces when a PC takes a violent action. When triggered, Summon 1d4 Minor Demons that are drawn to the carnage. They appear at a Close distance.
Quote4: “Lesser demons are drawn to the carnage, forming out of blood shed on the battlefield.”

Name: Dire Bat Vampire
Description: A wide-winged bat thrall/pet endlessly loyal to their vampire owner.
Tactics: Hide, Divebomb, Protect Leader
Text1: Attack rolls against this adversary while it is flying are at +3 difficulty.
Quote1: “The bats twists and soars through the air, evading your strikes.”
Text2: When any Vampire allies mark HP, you can mark Stress and have this adversary fly into melee with the attacker to make an attack at advantage against the creature that attacked the vampire. If successful, the target takes 2d6+2 phy.
Quote2: “The bat dives in front of your blow, protecting its master.”
Text3: Mark Stress to send a high-pitch screech out toward all targets in front of the Dire Bat within Far range. They must all mark 1d4 Stress.
Quote3: “The bat’s screech grates your spirit, taxing and infuriating at once.”

Name: Dryad
Description: A nature spirit in the form of a humanoid tree.
Tactics: Command, Cultivate, Drive Out, Preserve the Forest
Text1: Mark Stress to target a spot within Far range. Create a patch of thorns that covers everywhere within Close range of that spot. All creatures within that area suffer 2d6+2 phy damage whenever they act, and can escape with a Finesse (16) roll or by dealing 20+ damage with an attack.
Quote1: “The treant sings a short riff, and thorny brambles erupt from the ground.”
Text2: When another adversary dies within Close range, spend a Fear to clear 2 HP and 2 Stress on this adversary as the fallen ally’s life force is returned to the forest.
Quote2: “The dryad kneels down and draws the fading life from their ally, rising with eyes filled with tears of grief and rage.
Text3: Spend a Fear to grow three Treant Sapling Minions, who appear at Close range and instantly activate.
Quote3: “The dryad plants seeds, which instantly grow up into animate saplings.”

Name: Elemental Spark
Description: A blazing mote of elemental fire.
Tactics: Blast, Consume, Gain Mass
Text1: This adversary is defeated if they take any damage. For every 9 damage a PC deals to this adversary, defeat an additional minion in the attack’s range.
Quote1: “You cut through them effortlessly, one to the next.”
Text2: Choose a target and activate all Elemental Sparks within Close range of them. Those minions move into melee with the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 7 phy damage each. Combine this damage together.
Quote2: “They descend on you, stronger together.”

Name: Greater Earth Elemental
Description: A living landslide of boulders and dust, as large as a house.
Tactics: Pummel, Knock Over, Avalanche
Text1: This adversary costs 2 action tokens to activate.
Quote1: “They move slowly, but with great power.”
Text2: All targets hit by Greater Earth Elemental must mark an armor after taking damage (separate from reducing damage).
Quote2: “The elemental hits you with the force of a falling mountain.”
Text3: Any attack that would move Greater Earth Elemental moves it two fewer ranges (Far becomes Very Close, etc.) Whenever Greater Earth Elemental takes physical damage, reduce that damage by 7.
Quote3: “The elemental holds their ground, unmoved by your attack.”
Text4: Mark a Stress to create a rockslide in the Close area in front of Greater Earth Elemental. All creatures in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (19) or take 2d12+15 physical damage and become Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. On a successful reaction roll, they take half damage.
Quote4: “The elemental transforms into a living rockslide, barreling over you and trying to crush you beneath its form.”
